Reviews.Title: “Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Andrea S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: service excellent, Room ok- a bit too loud, location and amenities very good, The location is excellent, very close to La Rambla and metro station. The Best: Barcelona is a great city, very interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer than I expected”
Reviews.Author: TheDiamond82 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Have absolutely no complaints about this hotel. Really close to La Rambla (but as it turns out La Rambla is not a great place to hang around), nice spacious room, clean, nice shower, comfy bed, etc. For the price you can't complain. It's not amazing luxury wise but for value for money and location it was spot on. Read a couple of other reviews about it being in a dodgy area and I can see how people might think that but most places in Barcelona centre are busy, bustling and have lots of people around. I didn't think it was any worse than lots of areas I went to when there.

Reviews.Title: “good chioce”
Reviews.Author: chrisgr4
Reviews.Content: clean hotel...good location...approx 10-15 min walking for the port and 10-15 min aling for the city center..helpful staff..it was a good value for money choice even though you could get a more centrally located hotel..if you dont mind walking approx 10-15 min then its just fine

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend! As 2 Females, we were wary of young asian men on street.”
Reviews.Author: Brycie55
Reviews.Content: We were initially disappointed that our room was not ready at time of check in and the lady behind the desk was not at welcoming as comparison to precious experiences. We had clearly stated that we would like a non-smoking room so were again, disappointed to be located on a fully smoking floor. Regardless, staff became friendly and were happy to look after out bags after check out due to a late evening flight. This was much appreciated. It is fair to say that everyone's experiences of the location are different. Rambla de Raval is a lovely local square (rectangle) with a choice of bars. Being 2 females, we were wary of the young male Asian community to the right of the hotel and chose to walk down the middle pedestrian area for safety & comfort. No problems with Carrer lHopital, it's as busy with locals as the rest of Barcelona so just be as careful throughout your travels.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: ajzmann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our final leg of our Spanish honeymoon. While the reviews cautioned that this was in a more dangerous neighborhood, we found it to be lively and delightful. It was nice not staying directly on Las Ramblas, as the commotion there could get to be a bit much. We were a quick walk from Las Ramblas (less than ten minutes) and to a few metro stations as well. They did offer a continental breakfast, but at 12 euros or so, we never made that our breakfast place. There is a cute cafe next door for an affordable breakfast and a cafe con leche. We dined there each morning for about 5 euros per person. There are also many other little restaurants nearby that were quite good within a 5 minute walk. We appreciated that so we could avoid the tourist traps on Las Ramblas serving overpriced mediocre food. Prices were fair for the space. I think we paid approximately 125 USD each night for our room, which was pretty reasonable. The hotel was modern and clean. The rooms were comfortable and spacious for European hotel standards with newer bathrooms. Wifi was free. My only gripe was that for each time you wanted to log on, you had to be in the lobby and get a password. While I appreciated not having to incur an additional fee for this service, the passwords often didn't work, leading us to not have internet access. There is a desktop computer in the lobby for guest use, which is convenient. All in all, I'd stay here again. I can see why some might find the location a bit seedy, but I appreciated the fact that we glimpsed many vibrant cultures that make up the truly European city of Barcelona. Be cautious, and take a taxi if you don't feel comfortable. That being said, we didn't use taxis, aside from to get to the airport the morning we left. The hotel was kind enough to call us one that morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: nubbles21
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the Raval del Ramblas, about 8 mins. comfortable walk to Las Ramblas - and don't worry about "hospital road" as it appeared to us quite safe, very busy with all sorts of shops and cafes open until v.late and people about their business. Latest we walked down was around midnight and not a hint of trouble - certainly no drug dealing or hookers. Hotel was comfortable with helpful English speaking staff and a good breakfast buffet. Lots of toiletries and extras in bathroom, wine glasses and tumblers in room and mini fridge (which we emptied a bit so we could squeeze in bottle of wine). We discovered that if you walk straight down the square Raval del Ramblas, more of a rectangle really), away from hospital road end, you can get to the Marina much quicker than going to Las Ramblas and then walking down to the water. Raval del Ramblas is v.nice square, full of palm trees with green parakeets flitting about, lots of benches (one evening a little animated film was being shown to a small audience). The Restaurant Kapodokya serves v.good and excellent value sis kebab, doner, etc. etc. Tastes really fresh. Don't bother with La Fragua, rubbish tapas and meals. In fact sad to say we didn't find any decent tapas anywhere, not to say they don't exist. The "St.Joseph" Market just up the road in Las Ramblas is wonderful and stays open in the evening. We found little "bar" serving fino sherry at 2 euros (and plate of Serrano ham for 4 E) Would also recommend visit to Palau Guell, one of Gaudi's buildings, which is v.close by and not at all crowded (unlike Sagrada Familia, where we gave up on idea of queuing). The Palau Guell is abs.stunning inside. Its. v.short walk, other side of Las Ramblas, to the gothic quarter, where there are lots of shops and restaurants. We had really good 3-course lunch with wine and bread for 12.5E, opposite an art gallery but unfort. can't remember restaurant's name. Boat trip around harbour and coastline, 1.5 hrs, worth doing although sadly no commentary.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: dairymilkYorkshire
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was great, near enough to La Rambla without getting the noise, close enough to the Marina and plenty of cafes and bars on the doorstep. The hotel itself is very clean, the rooms were great and the staff were helpful. I went for a short break with the girls and we visited La Sagrada Familiar, Guell Parc, Casa Batllo, Fountains of Mont Juic and rode both routes of the city tour busses so that we saw the Olympic Stadium, Barcelona Football Stadium, the beach and all the other famous attractions. There really is so much to see in Barcelona! I would definitely return to Barcelona as we didn't get enough time there to see everything and I wouldn't hesitate in booking the Abba Rambla as my accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Super property, unfortunate location- though very close to Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: AnishaIndia
Reviews.Content: Rooms- Fantastic!!! Clean, comfortable, clean. Staff- Friendly, helpful and could speak english Location- Just off Ramblas- which is great!!! But the 5 min walk to Ramblas is through a street with hookers and looked unsafe. If you are in a bigger group with guys- the hotel is recommended. I wouldnt suggest just girls to be there by themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: minsagin
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight. Very friendly helpful staff whatever their job. All were attentive and professional. The room was simple and very clean. We appreciated the in room safe. The underground car park was very hard to negociate but with care it was fine for our stay. Why do people have to be so inconsiderate and park badly thus makng the next space unusable. The staff should call them and ask them to park properly. The location was good although I would say that there is a seedy area nearby and not to walk that way at night. A varied continental breakfast completed our most enjoyable stay. I would certainly look to the Abba chain again. This is our second experience and I really don't think it is worth looking at a higher grade hotel if there is an Abba in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ReneeandJohn
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights at the end of April. Found it to be very quiet, clean and modern. There are markets right out the front. It was an easy walk to La Rambla, as well as the metro and many great sights, as well as cafes, bakeries and restaurants. I don’t think you could pick a better location. The hotel staff were great, helpful and friendly. We got 15 mins of free internet with our booking, which we used to book the Abba Hotel in Bilbao as we were that impressed. I would not recommend the open top tourist buses. You can easily get the metro and public buses to any location. These buses are a waste of money ( I found out the expensive way).

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Hospital road”
Reviews.Author: LauraCoopz
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent I am very picky on which hotels I stay in and I must say that I was really happy with this hotel however I do feel the need to warn people away from a couple of streets in the vicinity of this hotel one of which was called hospital road. unfortunately on our first night a group of 20 men (did not look like locals) stood watching as 4 lads in their twenties robbed my mums gold necklace by ripping if of her and left us both shook up, we are not flashy or naive just very unlucky . We both travel lots but have never experienced anything like this before and from speaking to police and the reception staff this road in renowned it so please avoid this street an instead use the nou road to the bottom of the square where the police station is when walking to the ramblas apart from that a fab city !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for a great price”
Reviews.Author: CumbrianTraveller76
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and was very easy to find, its located on a square with bars and restaurants but this didn't mean that is was noisy at night. It's less than a 10 minute walk from Placa Cataluyna. The hotel was very clean and comfortable, the rooms were well equipped which included a mini bar, safe and the most comfortable beds I have ever had in a European hotel! The bathroom was spacious with a bath and shower with huge fluffy towels. This is part of a chain so it lacks a Spanish personality but in my opinion this means the service and facilities are better as they are monitored by a 'head office'

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel/location”
Reviews.Author: stac1985
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights with my partner in October 2010, it was our first time in Barcelona and we had a really good time. The hotel is clean and modern with very friendly staff. The location was a huge bonus as everywhere is easy to find and can be reached on foot. We went to the market every morning for breakfast as it was only a 5 min walk and there was so much choice from fresh fruit to pastries. The bonus for my boyfriend was the chip shop a few doors away from the hotel that sold good fish and chips and lucozade of all things. For people going to Barcelona for the first time this hotel is ideal, you are in a great location and can get out and see everything the city has to offer, the only time we used a taxi was to go to the football stadium as it was raining.

Reviews.Title: “very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sasa44Bonn_Germania
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located on a square within 5 walking minutes from the Rambla. It is very new and the rooms are modern, very clean and comfortable with nice bathrooms. The only thing that we had to critisize was that our window faced a sort of air shaft which didn't allow any direct sunlight or much fresh air - however it was very quite and we could enjoy a good sleep :-). The reception staff was very friendly and could give good advise on restaurants and scooter rents - a fabulous way to discover Barcelona! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Clean Great Location but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Bazzone
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful trip to Barcelona. Great Marathon and good time with friends. The hotel is in the perfect location. Down a short side street off the Rambla, in the middle of a gorgeous square sits the hotel. The square is lined with trees and cafes place their tables and chairs in the centre. There are also plenty of evening type bars around the square so no need to go looking as everything is literally on your doorstep. The hotel is spotless! Reception and rooms are modern and light. The receptionists were always friendly and helpful. Now for the only negative. I stayed 3 nights (Fri,Sat,Sun) and on the Friday and Saturday it was almost impossible to sleep until almost 4am when the noise outside died down. Traffic, bars, shouting etc. My room was on the first floor facing the square so if your after a quiet room on a weekend then I would suggest you ask for a room not facing the square. The Sunday night was fine, much quieter. Just what I needed after running 26 miles :) All in all, a lovely hotel in a lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem.”
Reviews.Author: marion_thompson_
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what it says it is and makes an excellent base for seeing Barcelona. It is spotless, the staff are friendly and helpful and the beds are sooo comfortable. The buffet breakfasts are good too. It may not be in the most solubrious of areas but not once did we feel under threat or even uncomfortable and the square it is situated in is great. We ate twice at La Fragua, opposite the hotel, because the food was good and well priced and had a lovely evening at La Barca del Salamanca on the port, a seafood place. Would most certainly stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alli_D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends on our annual shopping trip. The hotel is less than a 10 minute walk from La Ramblas in a busy area. There are a few nice restaurants and bars in the same square which are all very reasonably priced. They're favoured by locals so offer good tapas and a cosy atmosphere. The rooms are typical modern hotel rooms and have everything you need including a room safe. We had a front facing room with a little balcony overlooking the square. The bathrooms are very clean and functional. Breakfast was typical buffet fare and even the fussiest eaters would've found something to satisfy themselves for breakfast. The waiter was very helpful and couldn't do any more to help if there was anything you couldn't find. The only downside to our whole trip was being hassled to buy drugs on the way back to the hotel on our last night. Having said that, it could happen anywhere these days. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location, OK hotel with lots of little faults”
Reviews.Author: GreenwichNick
Reviews.Content: I think I'd like to give just under 3 stars. Two stars is way too mean, but three stars feels a little generous. Good points: I love the location - it's 5 mins walk west of Liceu metro, so also just 5 mins west of the middle of Las Ramblas. It's also just a few mins walk from Paral.lel and St Antoni metro stations. Rambla de Raval is a well maintained, smart, pleasant area well populated by bars and restaurants, but is away from hubbub of Las Ramblas.. I see some other reviews have said that the area seems dangerous, but it really isn't - that's just what the centre of Barcelona looks like, folks! The room was OK - clean, reasonable beds, a bathroom with a bath and shower, air con, and a safe large enough to fit my laptop in. Bad points: The bathroom smelled bad, particularly after the shower had steamed it up. This was the the common southern European bathroom smell, writ large. "Room service" was a tele-pizza service. You dial room service, and the receptionist just puts your straight through to the pizza place, who (on the occasion I called) spoke no language that I recognised - the guy at the end of the phone seemed to be fluent only in Shouty. I had to go to reception to as them to call, which worked fine, although the receptionist seemed grumpy at me asking him to do this. I'm sorry pal - I speak 4 European languages, and can usually get by in Spanish as well, but I can't manage Shouty. If you work in the tourist industry in a city like this, you are going to have to help occasionally. The TV was broken. I only realised this when I came back from a bar on my last night to watch the second half of the Ceuta vs Barcelona Copa del Rey game, and all I got was sound, no picture. I guess it had been broken throughout my stay. There was a great deal of loud talking in the corridors and door slamming from my fellow guests. I'd stay here again, if only to see whether my grizzles were one-offs, and I was just unlucky with that room and that date of stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Bargain and Close to Everything.”
Reviews.Author: jfoster4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Abba Rambla for 2 nights in late June, 2010. The location was central to all the sites you want to see. It is located off the actual Las Ramblas (3 blocks) on a street named Rambla Del Raval. The room was very nice and very clean and the staff was wonderful. A thing to keep in mind for air conditioning is that the "Snowman and Beach Umbrella" pictures on the thermostat don't mean cold & hot, they mean Summer and Winter (just the opposite). If you want air conditioning, put the thermostat on the Snowman icon. Once the manager helped with that, we were more than comfortable and enjoyed our stay very much. We would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “amazin find”
Reviews.Author: sarsvirus
Reviews.Content: I wasn't too sure abt the hotel because of the reviews but I thought it was awesome for the price. The room was a good size, the best part was there was a blacony which over-looked the rambla del raval and it sort of gave you a feel of the city whilst in the room. The rambla del raval is a lovely tree lined square, and theres a nice little cafe right next to the hotel where we had breakfast. the location was perfect for walkin around barca central. Would love to be able to return and stay there. Staff were very helpful, made us photocopies for some stuff we needed, and offered umbrellas on a rainy day

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: freecat
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed at the Abba Rambla 4 years ago now. Just wanted to say I'm really surprised at all the 'dangerous location' comments. I stayed for 4 days in Feb '06 (ticked the '07 box here because no '06 option), a holiday with a male friend (I'm female) and we had no problems with getting to and from the hotel on foot day or night! We mostly used Carrer del Hospital to get to and from hotel/Ramblas, no probs at all. In fact on reading the danger comments I really wondered had I missed something or were we walking around blind?! The only slightly hairy moment I felt we had was when we were walking down a street from the hotel to the Ramblas - it wasn't the Hospital one, think it was daytime but not sure - and we had to pass a small gang of men, one of whom was holding what looked like a big cudgel. I was a little bit scared but we just strolled past and nothing at all happened. Apart from this one thing, nothing, no feeling of not being safe at all, especially on carrer Hospital which is full of shops and cafes and always full of people. So many people have made the point about the dangerous location I can't say there's nothing in it but... Anyway, loved this hotel, my friend had found an unbelievable cheap deal somehow and we ended up with a twin room each. All the usual facilities, bathroom big, spotless, gorgeous and plenty of complementary toiletries. Breakfast was plentiful and in a really nicely decorated, swish, arty looking dining room. My husband and I have just been to Barcelona and I wanted to stay at the Abba Rambla again but unfortunately there was a net problem and we went somewhere else but that ended up quite nice too. I'd recommend the Abba to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Markate
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews about the area I was worried, but had no problems. My daughter and I walked to the hotel (15 mins) from Playa Catalunya with suitcases after 10pm and no one bothered us. We did work out exactly where we were going beforehand (no maps or guide books on show). Hotel was modern, clean and staff were friendly. We didn't have breakfast there, prefering to try the many cafes along the Ramblas. We found it to be very good value right in the heart of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidTahiti
Reviews.Content: Good accomodation for this hotel. Beds are ok and air conditioning is working perfectly to bad that our room was between groundfloor and basement...nice view on a wall. Bathroom clean but towels with holes Employees are very helpful We did not try the breakfast Location is ok but for sure not the most friendly square in Barcelona, a bit far from subway and buses if you wanna walk. We used taxis at night to leave and come back to the hotel. But finally who cares...just needed somewhere to put our bags, in barcelona you sure don't stay at the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Not for night people”
Reviews.Author: den531
Reviews.Content: I stayed at ABBA with wife , brother & Sister-in-law on May 10. We were using the hotel as a over nighter for a cruise on the Med sea on the 11th. The hotel is located in a 'seedy' part of Barcelona. We knew this when we booked thanks to TripAdvisor. We didn't care since we were not going to'Do the town' at night. It was a good hotel for that purpose. Across the street was a ''Flea market' every day. Nice to walk thru. The area was not for folks to be walking around after dark, in my opinion. Breakfeast was wonderful for 13 E's a person. Everything you could think of was there for you. Staff was excellent and the rooms were small but very clean including bathrooms in each room. Beds were not hard. A safe in the room. The A/C worked only if you kept the window closed. That took me a while to figure out but not terriable. It served our purpose well. There was even a taxi stand across rthe street and getting transportation to the pier was very simple.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, dont be put off by interesting neighbourhood!”
Reviews.Author: tuckersford
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 4 women aged 30 to 55, staying in Barcelona Mon-Wed. We caught the bus from girona to barcelona then a cab from the bus station to the hotel. Bus took just over an hour and cost 20e return, cab costs between 9e and 18e 1 way (have hotel and bus station address written down) . I had looked at hotel on google street view so wasn't concerned about the area. Arrived 20.30 at hotel, reception brght and modern. check in was really quick, receptionist very helpful. Our hotel room was much better than expected, very clean, it had everything you could ask for, free safe, hair drier, mini bar, toietries, a/c. Furnishings were new and modern, the size of the room was perfect for 2 people. No complaints about hotel other than breakfast was a bit expensive (13 euro each) we ate breakfast around the corner for under 3 euro!! The receptionist did warn us not to walk down l'hospital late at night, its true the street is full of dodgy looking men just hanging around, i wouldn't venture down it on my own very late at night, but we stuck together and had no trouble at all, its a very busy street lots of people around but im sure it can be a very different late at night. we wondered around at midnight and were fine.Please be on your guard if visiting l'hospital grounds, its seems to be a hang out for tramps, some bloke seemed oblivious to us when he exposed himself in the middle of the day. Pleae don't be put off by the area, there is lovely square just outside hotel and there are alternative routes to las ramblas. The location to main attractions in barcelona i don't think could be any better, only a 2 min walk to las ramblas. Lots of cheap places to eat even on the rambla, we had 3 courses plus drink on the rambla for 12e.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for 3 people- unsafe neighborhood at night”
Reviews.Author: olive_vietnam
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for 3 people at 120-130 euros and it's GREAT. It's initially a double room but we asked for an extra bed at no extra cost. Receptionists are very helpful. Room is clean. Bathroom is quite spacious and nice. Location is very central. The neighborhood is nice (palm trees and people sitting watching the world passing by) during the day. But don't walk outside at night especially in narrow alleys. My friend was robbed before my eyes when we walked back to the hotel at 11pm (and he's a big German guy).

Reviews.Title: “ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: Huggie103
Reviews.Content: room was clean, bed wasn't that comfortable, room not hat warm, very noisy, you could hear other guests very easily. good location, lovely italian across the square.

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: petra82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August with our two teenage children. It was our first time in Barcelona and a single friend had suggested the hotel due to very reasonable prices plus the fact that it was really central, a few minutes from the Ra Rambla. We have nothing but good words for the hotel itself. It was clean, spacious and we were given rooms looking front on the 3rf floor. The staff was very nice, helped us with maps, suggestions for reastaurants, tickets for flamengo dance etc and breakfast was super. But I do not know if I would choose it again ,as the neighbourhood looked dangerous. Barcelona is a wonderful city, full of nice neighbourhoods and I think we stayed at one of the worse. Dirty, bowery, we really did not feel safe to walk especially at night. It was a side of Barcelona we would not have seen if we had stayed elsewhere and I would not recommend it for families. Once again I must point out that the hotel itself was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulieHFM
Reviews.Content: The ABBA Hotel is a very nice hotel. Nice rooms, comfertable and modern. Good breakfast. The street towards the Ramblas was a bit shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Smile when out walking - no problems at all!”
Reviews.Author: Snorer007
Reviews.Content: The reviews here helped us find the quickest way to the hotel from the airport. We decided to walk from the square where the Aerobus from the airport dropped us. Straight down the Rambla until we saw the L'hospital Road and turned in. It was night time and yes I understand that the graffitti and the downbeat look of the area can be a little intimidating, but we liked the offbeat path that it provided. There were few hookers on the street corners and the inhabitants made up maiinly of North & West Africans, Pakistanis and Bangladeshis from what I could make out. We didn't feel at all threatened, maybe cos I am tall and look like an arab and blended with the 'background'. Infact we enjoyed a couple of meals in the square at night (outside) and in the morning found a really good cafe where we had breakfast so cheap it was unbelievable - Forns del PJ - found as you walk back to La Rambla on the L'Hospital Road and on the right just as you enter the last square. We even sat talking on the benches in the square for a couple of hours one evening. As for the hotel, I specifically asked for a double bed in the email and it was confirmed to me that they would have one for us. But in the room, it was 2 singles put together. I complained but they said it was because we checked in late(???) as we arrived at 10pm!! Lousy escuse. One or two things weren't right and were fixed the next day. The rooms were small but didn't matter as we didn't spend much tme there. The electronic safe in the wardrobe was a great help as we only carried what we needed to. On the last day we stopped by the Funicular near the Olympic Stadium. When we got to the bottom, we were within walking distance of the hotel where we were able to dump some stuff before moving on to other sightseeing. The hotel sells the 1 and 2 day passes on the Turistic open-top Buses. Go for the 2-day pass. 26Euros each and the same price as when you queue in the square. Don't be put off by the area. There are a lot of good shops selling stuff like fashion jewellry (which if you have lots of people to buy for) was a bargain as you can haggle with the chinese owner. He gave us a price below what I was prepared to pay. Then there were the local groceries selling 1Litre bottles water for 60 cents as opposed to a can of Coke outside the Musea D'Art for 5 Euros!!!!! Ladies, just make sure the handbags are sandwiched between you and your partner when out walking, men, don't put your wallet in your back pocket. Be safe!

Reviews.Title: “Yes. it's not Bognor Regis, but it is a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glenshiro
Reviews.Content: I agree the approach along Carrer de l' Hospital could be a little daunting at night to a single female traveller, (although in fact unlikely to be the subject of any real attention) but the route from the south is much nicer. Hotel itself is excellent, very good value for central Barcelona and obviously very popular with business and tourist guests alike. Everything is spotlessly clean and works - good bathroom, free safe in the room, trouser press, minibar and aircon. Our room (overlooking a sidestreet) not overlarge, but we both remarked on how comfortable the beds were. Breakfast adequate if a bit overpriced at €12, friendly, helpful staff, and the Rambla del Raval itself is pleasant, wide, tree-lined and has a selection of bars and restaurants - especially liked the giant bronze cat! I, too, was surprised at the prostitutes on the main Rambla - not there on my last visit, but not especially obtrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Dodgy neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Morningsider
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights whilst holidaying in Barcelona. Whilst the square in which the hotel is situated is quite okay, the street leading to it from the Ramblas is quite dodgy. Lots of migrants just wandering around and a fair few cops on the beat all the time. If you've your wits about you, there should be no reason to be alarmed. 15 minute walk to the Catalunya square for the airport shuttle (4.05 euros one way). This is easily the best way to get to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in poor area”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeOwl
Reviews.Content: Went to Barcelona 10 years ago and enjoyed the Rambla area so decided to stay there on our return visit. Poor choice. The area is now busy, dirty and the home of many migrant workers and prostitutes. The hotel is excellent value. Staff helpful & well informed. The room was a good size with comfortable beds and nice bathroom well serviced. The air conditioning was efficient.. We did not avail ourselves of the breakfast, 12 Euros extra, but the coffee I bought was undrinkable, Overall an excellent little hotel in a once pleasant square. The area is fine by day but we felt unsafe at night. OK for those travelling in a party, not good for single feamles.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, But”
Reviews.Author: exeman
Reviews.Content: Hotel is really good. Clean room and public areas, helpful staff, good buffet breakfast etc. However, my wife never felt comfortable in the area and sure enough had her handbag stolen whilst eating outside at a nearby restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “The Winner Takes It All!”
Reviews.Author: angli4anin
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the Abba Rambla as it is hard to find an affordable hotel just a few minutes' walk away from La Rambla. I was surprised that it is only a three star hotel - I have stayed in four stars a lot worse than this one. The rooms were clean and very modern in style. Customer service was excellent. The TV wasn't working but they had an engineer up within 5 minutes of my phoning down to reception who fixed it straight away. It is true that the location isn't the ritziest and glamourous in all of Central Barcelona as it is an area of immigrants. I didn't feel in the slightest bit intimidated there though (mind you, I have lived in some pretty scary places in my time!). The upside is that there is some very cheap shopping and supermarkets around and a good choice of cheap ethnic food such as kebabs and curries. If ever I go back to Barcelona, this will be the first hotel that I try and book as I think it offers exceptional value for money in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “previous reviews are accurate”
Reviews.Author: flucht07
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding value. Clean with super friendly multilingual staff, this is a great little hotel. The breakfast is optional, but well worth the money. The location was great for seeing the city and yes the 5 minute walk to Las Ramblas is typical inner city, but this Barcelona not Beverley Hills. The bath was a clean modern surprise, and our room was very quiet. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “abba rambla”
Reviews.Author: lindaewan
Reviews.Content: The Abba Rambla is a lovely hotel with a great location. It is close walking distance (1/3 mile approximately) to Las Ramblas. The hotel was very clean with modern decor in the rooms. My room faced a busy plaza but the heavy duty windows kept the room very quiet! Room darkening draperies let me sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Grassy23
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed an excellet 5 days at the Abba Rambla! Rooms were immaculate and the staff couldn't be more helpful! In a great location just off Las Ramblas although you do have to pass a few 'colourful' characters on the short walk! 5/5

Reviews.Title: “Great central place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CPorter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of March for a long weekend. At first I was a little weary of the area after reading the reviews, but once we got there, I found it ok. We were out after midnight most nights and found the walk back to the hotel fine. Hotel was great, staff were very firndly and helpful, telling you of places to visit etc. Rooms were very modern and clean, with fresh towels and stocked minibar everyday. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a central area”
Reviews.Author: CDP4
Reviews.Content: Just spent Christmas in this hotel and was a bit concerned regarding peoples reviews on the position of the hotel. Yes, you do have to walk though some back streets to get there but we didnt see any trouble. I can imagine it can be a bit daunting for women on their own but if you walk through the square in the direction of the port you miss out most of these streets. In any case, it is just full of people going about their daily business and gives you a different side of Barcelona. You are more likely to become the victim of a pickpocket on the Ramblas than in these streets. The hotel itself was lovely - we had a room with a small balcony overlooking the square - which was noisy - but the double glazing was so good that once the windows were closed we couldnt hear anything. One thing - they have smaoking and non smoking floors -- we were on a smoking floor which wasnt a problme as the hotel wasnt full, but worth asking for a non smoking floor if you require it. Great breakfast selection and lovely decoration and comfortable rooms. All in all very good value for money and a great stay.
